app.noTracksMessage: Drop your audio files above to get started

basics.playbackDesc: Use the floating play/pause button or press SPACE to control playback. Adjust playback speed from 0.25x to 4.0x for practice at your own pace.
basics.title: Getting Started
basics.uploadDesc: Drag and drop audio files (MP3, WAV, OGG, etc.) or click the upload area. Your tracks are stored locally in your browser.

loops.activeDesc: Click on a loop chip to activate it: playback will automatically jump back to the start when reaching the end. Click again to deactivate.
loops.editDesc: Click the 'Edit' icon in the top bar to enter edit mode. In edit mode, click on the waveform to place markers. Click-and-drag to create loops directly. Markers can be repositioned by dragging them.
loops.manageDesc: Markers and loops appear as clickable chips. Click a marker: jump to that position. Click a loop: activate it. Menu (⋮): set as loop start/end or delete. Long-press a marker: create a loop.
loops.openDesc: Markers (numbered) and loops (colored zones) are displayed directly on the waveform.
loops.title: Markers and loops

tips.tip1: Click on track names to rename them
tips.tip2: Files are saved in your browser - no internet required after loading
tips.tip3: Clicking on a marker automatically disables the active loop
tips.tip4: You can create multiple loops and switch between them instantly
tips.title: Tips & Tricks

tracks.soloLong: Long press: Exclusive solo (unmute all + solo only this track)
tracks.soloShort: Short press: Solo this track (mute all others)
tracks.title: Track Controls
tracks.volumeDesc: Each track has its own volume slider. There's also a master volume control in the bottom bar.

welcome.description: Stemux is a multi-track audio player designed for musicians who want to practice with isolated stems. Load your tracks, control volumes independently, and create loops for focused practice.
welcome.title: Welcome to Stemux!

pieces.title: Pieces Management
pieces.description: Organize your work by creating multiple pieces. Each piece keeps its tracks, loops, and settings separately. Click "Stemux ▼" at the top to access the menu: create, rename, delete, or switch between your pieces.

markers.deleteAllConfirmMessage: This action will permanently delete all markers ({markerCount}) and all loops ({loopCount}). This action cannot be undone.
markers.title: Markers

menu.deleteAllConfirmMessage: Are you sure you want to delete all tracks? This action cannot be undone.
menu.title: Menu

pieces.title: Manage Pieces
pieces.deleteConfirmMessage: This will permanently delete the piece "{{name}}" and all its tracks ({{count}}). This action cannot be undone.
pieces.deleteAllConfirmMessage: This will permanently delete ALL pieces and their tracks. This action cannot be undone.

recordingGuide.title: Recording Guide
recordingGuide.intro: To record with your microphone, two permissions are required.
recordingGuide.step1Description: Your device (Android/iOS) must allow Chrome/Safari to access the microphone. Check in Settings → Apps → Chrome → Permissions.
recordingGuide.step2Description: This site needs your permission to use the mic. A popup will appear, click 'Allow'.
recordingGuide.step3Description: Arm a track (REC button), then press Play to record.
recordingGuide.troubleshoot: If problems occur: check that Chrome has microphone access in your phone settings.
recordingGuide.footer: This message will only show once. You can show it again from the help menu.

recording.title: Recording
recording.notSupported: Recording is not supported by your browser
